title: Christmas Card
originalText:
Frohe
Weihnachten
und viel
Glück
im neuen
Jahr

Dresden, d. 12.12.82
wünschen Dir liebe Bübi,
sowie Deiner Familie aus
der fernen Heimat Dein alter
Freund
Erich u. Gattin.

Uns geht es den Umständen ent.
sprechend noch halbwegs gut.
Gesundheitlich könnte es mir besser
gehen, ich habe sehr unter hohen
Blutdruck zu leiden. Wir gehen ja
nun auf die 60 zu, und da muß man
mit solchen weh - Wehchen eben
rechnen. Wie geht es Dir lieber
Bübi, bist du wenigstens noch bei
bester Gesundheit oder haben bei
Dir auch schon die Generalrepara-
turen begonnen. Wenn du Zeit
hast schreibe mir bitte auch wieder
mal paar Zeilen, ich würde mich sehr
darüber freuen. Oder hast du gar vor
Dresden wieder mal zu besuchen??
Nochmals herzliche Grüße von Deinen alten Freunden
Erich.
translatedText:
Happy
Christmas
and much
luck
in the new
year

Dresden, Dec. 12, 1982
Your old friend Erich and wife send wishes to you, dear Bübi, and your family from the distant homeland.

We are, considering the circumstances, still halfway well. Health-wise, it could be better; I suffer greatly from high blood pressure. We are approaching 60 now, and one has to expect such aches and pains. How are you, dear Bübi? Are you at least still in best health, or have the general repairs already begun for you too? If you have time, please write me a few lines again; I would be very happy about it. Or do you even plan to visit Dresden again??
Warmest regards again from your old friends
Erich.
description: The postcard consists of two sides. One side features a pre-printed holiday greeting in German ("Frohe Weihnachten und viel Glück im neuen Jahr") in an old German (Fraktur) script, centered on a plain white background. The other side contains a handwritten personal message in German, dated "Dresden, d. 12.12.82", on a plain, light-colored paper background. There is no specific imagery or artwork visible on either side beyond the text itself.

title: Dresden Views
originalText:
1 Kronentor des Zwingers
2 Blick zum Terrassen ufer
3 „Goldener Reiter“
4 Prager Straße
5 Dr.-Friedrichs-Brücke
6 Blick zum Rathaus und zur Kreuzkirche

Lieber Bubi u. Familie!
Entschuldige bitte die Verspätung des Oster- u. Neuj. Grüße aus Dresden. Alf
Bei uns war es vor u. bei allen den Feiertagen die Handwerker so daß vieles nicht geworden ist. Uns geht es ganz gut, jedes Jahr wird wieder etwas neues geschaffen. Hauptsache wir bleiben alle gesund, dass ich auch von Euch hoffe.
Viele Grüße aus dem schönen
Dresden. Alfred u. Foren
Könnt Du mal wieder?
translatedText:
1 Crown Gate of the Zwinger
2 View to the Terrace Embankment
3 "Golden Rider"
4 Prager Street
5 Dr.-Friedrichs Bridge
6 View to the City Hall and the Kreuzkirche

Dear Bubi and Family!
Please excuse the delay for Easter and New Year's greetings from Dresden. Alf
With us, before and during all the holidays, the craftsmen were around, so that much could not be done. We are doing quite well, every year something new is created again. The main thing is that we all stay healthy, which I also hope for you.
Many greetings from beautiful
Dresden. Alfred and Foren
Can you visit again?
description: The postcard features a collage of six black-and-white photographs of famous landmarks and cityscapes in Dresden, Germany. These include the Kronentor of the Zwinger palace, a view of the Elbe River's terrace embankment, the "Golden Rider" statue, a street scene of Prager Straße, an aerial view of the Dr.-Friedrichs Bridge, and a panorama showing the City Hall and Kreuzkirche. A central banner reads "Grüße aus Dresden" (Greetings from Dresden).

title: Dresden to Caribbean
originalText:
12. 5. 72
Lieber Bubu u Familie.
Warum schreibst Du gar nicht mal. Habe
meine Post alle von Santo
Domingo wieder zurück
bekommen. Hast Du eine
neue Adresse? Dein Paket
von jener haben mir nicht
mehr erhalten. Habe Dir
paarmal geschrieben schon
schreiben Dich auch mal bitter
kurz. Es grüßt Dich herzlich
Deiner Richard u Frank.
translatedText:
May 12, 1972
Dear Bubu and family.
Why don't you ever write? I received all my mail back from Santo Domingo. Do you have a new address? We haven't received your package from there anymore. I've written to you a few times already, please write back a short note too. Warm greetings to you, Your Richard and Frank.
description: The postcard features a collage of black and white photographs showcasing landmarks and scenes from Dresden. In the center, 'Grüße aus DRESDEN' (Greetings from DRESDEN) is written in white sans-serif font on a dark background. The images include a steamboat ('Weiße Flotte' - White Fleet) on a river, the Zwinger palace complex (several views, including a fountain and exterior), the 'Kulturpalast' (Culture Palace) with cars on a street in front, and the 'Goldener Reiter' (Golden Rider) statue.

title: Dresden Railway
originalText:
Sippych.
Es ist mir endlich lieb wohl, andere Päckchen noch.
Hätte mir gern an der Goofi Böller Geschirr und Haustand was sinner hönsamm.
Die ich hörte war einie wunderschön.
Opa hat viel oder sind verheizt, kann kommen.
Geht viel lieber hin zu mir, Sande...
translatedText:
Sippych.
I am finally well pleased, still other packages.
I would gladly have some Goofi crackers, dishes and household items, whatever is so cozy.
The one I heard about was a beautiful one.
Grandpa has a lot or they are used up, he can come.
It is much better to come to me, Sande...
description: A black and white photograph of a steep hillside covered with numerous buildings and trees. A funicular railway track, supported by a large steel trestle, ascends diagonally up the slope, with two cars visible on the tracks. At the very top of the hill, a prominent, large building complex with a tower can be seen, resembling a castle or large estate. Faint text 'Dresden, Stand...' is visible in the bottom left corner.

title: New Year's Card
originalText:
29. 11. 83
Lieber Bruni,
u. Familie!
Nach sehr lange Zeit
einige herzliche Grüsse
aus dem Heimath
mit der Hoffnung das
es u. deiner Familie
gesund geht
u. gleichzeitig ein
frohes Weihnachten
u. gesundes Neujahrs
wünscht Euch
Onkel Horst + T. domiz
sowie meine Familie.

Evtl. kannst Du mir
einmal von diesem
meinen Eltern senden.
liebe viel Richard
nicht mehr da, aber
frank besuche ich ab + zu.
translatedText:
29. 11. 83
Dear Bruni,
and family!
After a very long time
some heartfelt greetings
from home
with the hope that
you and your family
are well
and at the same time
wish you
a Merry Christmas
and a healthy New Year
Uncle Horst + T. Domiz
as well as my family.

Perhaps you can send me
one of these (or this one) to my parents.
Dear Richard
is no longer there, but
I visit Frank now and then.
description: The front of the postcard features a charming, whimsical illustration in an oval frame. A striped, orange cat with a white belly and red cheeks is climbing a tree-like structure that resembles a birch log. The log has black spots and is topped with a small brown cap and two red mushrooms. Green foliage branches out from the log. Two birds, one reddish-brown and one blue and yellow, are perched on the branches. A pretzel-like shape hangs from one branch. There are also a few colorful, stylized flowers and a smiling sun-like figure. At the bottom, in an arched banner, are the words "PROSIT NEUJAHRS" (Happy New Year).

title: Scout Camp 1934
originalText:
Den lints! auf aufs
Grüße; Stürm; Jungens; Eugen, Zeuber,
Prisort; Heimann, Goop
Prüfel; Grundlich; Dallfur, Zemuy;
translatedText:
To the left one! Up, up!
Greetings; Stürm; Youngsters; Eugen, Zeuber,
Prisort; Heimann, Goop
Prüfel; Gründlich; Dallfur, Zemuy;
description: A black and white photograph showing eleven young boys or teenagers in uniform, standing in a line in a grassy field. They are wearing short-sleeved shirts, dark shorts, dark socks, and boots, with neckerchiefs or ties. Several large canvas tents are visible in the background, suggesting a camp setting. The overall scene depicts a youth group in an outdoor environment.

title: Deer Park
originalText:
Zur Erinnerung
an Ferien 1934.
Hermann Moritzburg
und
6. Juni 1934.
translatedText:
In memory
of vacation 1934.
Hermann Moritzburg
and
June 6, 1934.
description: A black and white photograph shows a young boy, viewed from behind, standing next to a wooden post and looking at several deer. One deer with small antlers is close to the boy. Other deer are scattered in the foreground and mid-ground, some grazing. In the background, there is a dense forest of trees.

title: Dresden Letter 1980
originalText:
Dresden, 28.11.80
Lieber Bubi u. Familie!
Wünscht Euch von Herzen Richard Franks Ragfcula u. Duni.

Du erst möchte ich mal anfragen ob Ihr alle noch
Gesund seid. Uns geht es zum soweit noch gut. Nun ist
ja bald wieder Weihnachten das sind nun schon die 2
ohne meine Mütze, ich komme nicht darüber hinweg
Kann es nicht fassen. Gehe jeden Tag an Ihr Grab. Meine
Freude am leben ist vorbei. Werde meiner Maisie wieder
einen kleinen Weihnachtsbaum mit Kerzen auf Ihr
Grab stellen. Wenn ich bei Ihr war, hab ich es
wieder Ruhe. Habe sonst auch immer viel Arbeit
gehe noch 3 Tage arbeiten, bin ja auch Rentner sonst
wird es mir zu langweilig. Hans mit seiner
Frau waren dieses Jahr auch in Dresden habe
mich tüchtig gefreut. Hat Ihm auch gepasst.
haben schöne Fahrten gemacht, Streller Georg
ist auch gestorben der 92 Jahre.

Viele herzli. Grüsse
Sendet Euch Richard

Frohe Weihnachten
und viel Glück
im neuen
Jahr
translatedText:
Dresden, 28.11.80
Dear Bubi and Family!
Richard Franks Ragfcula and Duni wish you all the best from their hearts.

First, I wanted to ask if you are all still healthy. We are still doing well so far. Soon it will be Christmas again, and this is already the second one without my wife. I can't get over it. I can't grasp it. I go to her grave every day. My joy in life is over. I will put a small Christmas tree with candles on her grave for my Maisie again. When I have been with her, I have peace again. Otherwise, I still have a lot of work; I will work for 3 more days. I am also a retiree, otherwise, I would get too bored. Hans and his wife were also in Dresden this year, I was very happy about it. It also suited him. We made nice trips. Streller Georg also passed away at 92 years old.

Many warm greetings
Richard sends you

Merry Christmas
and a Happy New Year
description: The postcard features a handwritten message on one side, dated Dresden, 28.11.80. The other side (front) has a festive greeting printed in an old-fashioned German script (Fraktur) on a plain white background, stating "Frohe Weihnachten und viel Glück im neuen Jahr" (Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year).

title: Dresden Panorama
originalText:
Lieber Onkel Bubi, Tante Rita u. Kinder.
Mit großer Freude haben wir
Euer Packet über Geneves Weih-
nachten erhalten. Haben uns
sehr gefreut. Hoffentlich seid Ihr
alle noch gesund und auch
den Wurstgewittern "geht es noch
gut." Jahren schon so drollig aus.
Viele Grüße über den großen Teich
senden Euch Frank, Mutti u. Vati.
translatedText:
Dear Uncle Bubi, Aunt Rita and children.
With great joy we have
received your package over Geneves Christmas. We were
very happy. Hopefully you are
all still healthy and also
with the "sausage storms" it's still going
well. Years already so funny.
Many greetings across the big pond
send you Frank, Mom and Dad.
description: The front of the postcard features a black and white collage of images from Dresden, Germany. A large central image shows the ornate architecture of the Zwinger palace with fountains. Smaller inset images depict river views and other cityscapes. The word "DRESDEN" is prominently displayed in white letters on a black rectangle, and a coat of arms (a lion rampant with stripes) is visible in the bottom left corner.
